info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 5:33AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Wabash, Grant, northwestern Blackford, southwestern Huntington, east central Cass and Miami Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 533 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Peru to near Kokomo to 9 miles southeast of Frankfort. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Swayzee around 545 AM EDT. Wabash and Sweetser around 550 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Marion, Fairmount, Jonesboro, La Fontaine, Gas City, Upland, Andrews and Matthews. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 252 and 278. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
